newsitem.title: USA: UroQuest cuts proposed IPO price range.
newsitem.headline: UroQuest cuts proposed IPO price range.

text.p: UroQuest Medical Corp cut the estimated pricing range for its shares to be offered in its initial public offering to $6 to $8 each, according to a regulatory filing.

The Salt Lake City company had previously planned to offer the 3.35 million shares in a range of $8 to $10. Uroquest makes products aimed at diagnosing and treating urological disorders such as incontinence and retention.
Lead underwriter Dillon Read said the offering is expected to price Thursday for trading on Friday.
Uroquest originally estimated a pricing range of $11 to $13 in a June filing. It has proposed to trade on Nasdaq under the symbol UROQ.O.
A source close to the deal said it was expected to price at $6.
